action.action-desc: Ms. Barragán (for herself, Ms. Norton, Ms. Titus, and Mr. Gutiérrez) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To amend title 41, United States Code, to require sexual harassment training for the employees of Federal contractors, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Federal Contractor Anti-Harassment Training Act of 2018.

section.header: Sexual harassment training for employees of Federal contractors

subsection.header: Sexual harassment training for employees of Federal contractors

paragraph.text: Chapter 63 of title 41, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Sexual harassment training for employees of Federal contractors

subsection.text: As a condition for the award of a contract, the head of an executive agency shall—

subparagraph.text: to provide mandatory sexual harassment training—

clause.text: to each employee of the contractor on a biennial basis; and
to each employee hired by the contractor on or after the date of the award of the contract not later than 90 days after such date and on a biennial basis thereafter; and

subparagraph.text: to ensure that any subcontractor of the contractor provides mandatory sexual harassment training to the employees of the subcontractor, in accordance with the requirements described in subparagraph (A); and

paragraph.text: allow such contractor, and any subcontractor of such contractor, to use the sexual harassment training materials and resources of the executive agency in providing such mandatory sexual harassment training.

subsection.text: In this section, the term executive agency has the meaning given that term in section 102 of title 40.

paragraph.text: The table of sections at the beginning of such chapter is amended by adding at the end the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 6310. Sexual harassment training for employees of Federal contractors.

subsection.text: The amendment made by subsection (a)(1) shall apply with respect to contracts awarded on or after the date that is 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
